content:
• Monday, November 28, 2011
  • HI

    More on Hillenbrand (NYSE:HI): FQ4 easily beat estimates as revenue rose 9% Y/Y, driven by...

    More on Hillenbrand (NYSE:HI): FQ4 easily beat estimates as revenue rose 9% Y/Y, driven by acquisitions and strong gains in its process equipment group - its fastest-growing business platform. "Process Equipment Group has embarked on a global growth initiative that is opening up new geographies for its brands, including newly acquired Rotex, says President and CEO Kenneth Camp. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) offers upward revenue guidance for the next two quarters: FQ2 is...

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) offers upward revenue guidance for the next two quarters: FQ2 is now $2.8B expected vs. the consensus estimate of $2.65B, FQ3 is $3.75B expected vs. $3.22B consensus. While its component and disk drive factories have not been directly affected by floods in Thailand, the company says component supply has been constrained. STX +5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • SUSS

    Texas convenience store owner Susser Holdings (NYSE:SUSS) drops 3.7% AH after announcing plans...

    Texas convenience store owner Susser Holdings (NYSE:SUSS) drops 3.7% AH after announcing plans to issue 3.5M shares, good for proceeds of $88M based on today's close. Susser plans to use the proceeds to boost its 2012 store expansion program.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • ORA

    Ormat Technologies (ORA +4.8%) finished higher today after announcing it's signed a $65M...

    Ormat Technologies (ORA +4.8%) finished higher today after announcing it's signed a $65M contract and credit agreement with Lightning Dock Geothermal, a subsidiary of privately held Cyrq Energy, in connection with the construction of a geothermal project in New Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • PRU

    Prudential (PRU +4.5%) says its real estate investment business has acquired a Class A office...

    Prudential (PRU +4.5%) says its real estate investment business has acquired a Class A office building located in downtown Chicago's Central Loop for $183.5M. The 17-story building, located 22 West Washington, is fully leased and houses the corporate headquarters of Morningstar and the Chicago's CBS television affiliate.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • TROW

    T. Rowe Price (TROW +5.5%) trades higher after Ticonderoga ups the shares to Buy from Neutral,...

    T. Rowe Price (TROW +5.5%) trades higher after Ticonderoga ups the shares to Buy from Neutral, citing better fund flows, the company's dominant position in the investment management industry and leading equity fund performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • GRPN

    The bloodletting in Groupon (GRPN -10.1%) and LinkedIn (LNKD -9.3%), occurring in the absence of...

    The bloodletting in Groupon (GRPN -10.1%) and LinkedIn (LNKD -9.3%), occurring in the absence of major news, and on a day when most high-beta names are surging, has accelerated in the final hour of trading. Groupon has been a favorite of short-sellers all month, and many expected LinkedIn to see ongoing selling pressure following the recent end of its IPO lockup.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 8 Comments
  • TUDO

    Tudou (TUDO +4.3%) signs a TUDO) today announced that it has signed a program license agreement...

    Tudou (TUDO +4.3%) signs a TUDO) today announced that it has signed a program license agreement for the exclusive license of Japanese anime produced by TV Tokyo Corporation and TY Tokyo Medianet, with an initial term of two years and an option to renew the deal for an additional two years.">two-year licensing agreement to broadcast Japanese anime produced by TV Tokyo Corporation and TY Tokyo Medianet, with an option to renew the deal for an additional two years. Under the agreement, Tudou will have exclusive rights to simulcast a number of popular Japanese anime programs throughout Mainland China.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • TLT

    Despite a big green day in equities worldwide, price action in Treasuries reminds that risk...

    Despite a big green day in equities worldwide, price action in Treasuries reminds that risk remains and the economy is still slow. A Pavlovian move higher early reverses with the 10 year yield now lower by a basis point to 1.96%, after hitting 2.08% this morning. TLT flat for the day, +28% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • NKE

    Shares of Nike (NKE +4.5%) follow basketball-related companies Foot Locker (FL +8.6%) and...

    Shares of Nike (NKE +4.5%) follow basketball-related companies Foot Locker (FL +8.6%) and Madison Square Garden (MSG +9.5%) (I, II) higher following a tentative resolution to the NBA work stoppage. Despite predictions from analysts that the lockout wouldn't dent shoe sales, the return of games could signal that sales of broader NBA-licensed merchandising - tallied at $3B last year - will beat recent estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • POZN

    Pozen (POZN +3.9%) gains after saying it's sold most of the future royalty and milestone...

    Pozen (POZN +3.9%) gains after saying it's sold most of the future royalty and milestone payments under its licensing agreement with Glaxo Group covering Treximet sales in the United States, to a financial investor for $75M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL +4.1%) jumps after receiving final FDA approval of its Abbreviated New Drug...

    Mylan (MYL +4.1%) jumps after receiving final FDA approval of its Abbreviated New Drug Application for its chemoprotective agent Dexrazoxane for injection, a generic version of Pharmacia & Upjohn's Zinecard.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW +5.9%) is upped to Buy from Neutral at Davenport, writing that the company’s...

    Corning (GLW +5.9%) is upped to Buy from Neutral at Davenport, writing that the company’s glass sales could rise on double-digit growth in global LCD TV units. While LCD TVs apparently were flying off U.S. shelves this past weekend, the big story is in China, where LCD sales may grow 15% this year, and in emerging Latin American and Asian countries who may collectively see a 42% Y/Y gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • BAC

    The selloff from the opening pop in Bank of America (BAC -0.1%) accelerates, with the stock...

    The selloff from the opening pop in Bank of America (BAC -0.1%) accelerates, with the stock turning red while the rest of its banking brethren remain sharply higher. BofA was up more than 5% earlier. The big winner among the TBTFs is Citigroup (C +5.5%) despite having its slap of the wrist settlement with the SEC thrown out.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSMT

    Shares of PriceSmart (PSMT +4.4%) rally with the rest of consumer stocks, after record Black...

    Shares of PriceSmart (PSMT +4.4%) rally with the rest of consumer stocks, after record Black Friday weekend sales lift the sector as well as the broader markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • IMO

    Imperial Oil (IMO +5.6%) trades higher after saying it's resuming talks with Ottawa over a...

    Imperial Oil (IMO +5.6%) trades higher after saying it's resuming talks with Ottawa over a financial support package for its Mackenzie gas pipeline in the Far North.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +13.5%) shares spike on a report that the developer of the Nexavar...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +13.5%) shares spike on a report that the developer of the Nexavar kidney cancer treatment is exploring options, including a possible sale. Onyx reportedly is working with Centerview Partners to review alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth Group (UNH +3.3%) holds on to gains after the company re-affirms its outlook for...

    UnitedHealth Group (UNH +3.3%) holds on to gains after the company re-affirms its outlook for FY11 at its investor conference earlier today. Expectations are for earnings of between $4.52 - $4.57 per share, in line with consensus estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +3.4%) gets a lift after announcing it's received FDA approval for...

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +3.4%) gets a lift after announcing it's received FDA approval for the expansion of its manufacturing facility in Novato, CA. The facility will support will the company's enzyme replacement therapy portfolio, and provide up to $1B in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +0.3%) is underperforming thanks to a WSJ column that took a critical view...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +0.3%) is underperforming thanks to a WSJ column that took a critical view of its aggressive M&A spending, and also noted the sale of 677K shares by an investment group controlled by CEO Kaleil Isaza Tuzman. However, shares have bounced a little after KIT retierated its Q4 guidance, and claimed Tuzman was not a "beneficial seller" in the aforementioned sale. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • BSAC

    Banco Santander-Chile (SAN +3.1%) gets a lift after Deutsche ups it to Buy on valuation....

    Banco Santander-Chile (SAN +3.1%) gets a lift after Deutsche ups it to Buy on valuation. Deutsche says the stock's downside should be limited since the Chilean bank filed a statement saying that Santander Spain will not sell any more shares for at least one-year following the completion of its recently announced offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MSFT

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD -2.6%) drift lower after a Forbes article suggests their fair value...

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD -2.6%) drift lower after a Forbes article suggests their fair value should be $43 vs. the current $61 and change, even as a weaker economy and continued high unemployment should continue to add users.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • FCX

    Today's bounce in copper futures is helping to push copper mining stocks higher:...

    Today's bounce in copper futures is helping to push copper mining stocks higher: Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX +6.6%), Augusta Resource (AZC +6.2%), Southern Copper (SCCO +6%), Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +5.8%), HudBay Minerals Inc. (HBM +5.5%), Taseko Mines (TGB +4.3%) and Western Copper & Gold (WRN +3.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT +6.2%) gets a boost after Keefe Bruyette initiates the stock with an Outperform...

    Green Dot (GDOT +6.2%) gets a boost after Keefe Bruyette initiates the stock with an Outperform on valuation, citing its unique business model, strong brand recognition and a solid distribution network. Separately, Sterne Agee notes its purchase of Bonneville Bancorp will remove some variable costs and reduce its dependence on third parties.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • TAP

    Morgan Stanley issues frosty comments on Molson Coors (TAP +2.1%), saying that distributers...

    Morgan Stanley issues frosty comments on Molson Coors (TAP +2.1%), saying that distributers don't expect a pickup in volumes this holiday season due to a "secular" slowdown in the beer industry. Analysts with the firm reiterate an Equal-Weight rating on TAP, warning EPS estimates may be too high on the brewer.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (PRGS +3.7%) moves up after naming Jay Bhatt, a former executive at Autodesk,...

    Progress Software (PRGS +3.7%) moves up after naming Jay Bhatt, a former executive at Autodesk, as its president and CEO. The business-software maker said in August its current President and CEO Richard Reidy would step down once a successor was named.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • GEOS

    Seismic instrument maker OYO Geospace (OYOG +17.4%) ramps higher after saying it's received a...

    Seismic instrument maker OYO Geospace (OYOG +17.4%) ramps higher after saying it's received a $7.4M order from an affiliate of Breckenridge Exploration to purchase one of its wireless seismic data systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • C

    Morgan Stanley cuts its outlook and price targets on big U.S. banks, citing economic concerns in...

    Morgan Stanley cuts its outlook and price targets on big U.S. banks, citing economic concerns in the U.S. and Europe. Most notably, it cuts Citigroup (C +5.8%) to Equal Weight from Overweight and trims its price target to $30 from $45. Cut to Underweight: STT +1.7%, BK +1.4%, NTRS +1.4%. But for today at least, bank stocks (XLF +3%) are rallying.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • TAOM

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (TAOM +7.3%), which just went public earlier this year,...

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (TAOM +7.3%), which just went public earlier this year, trades up after announcing a $10M stock buyback this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.5%) and Ericsson (ERIC +6.4%) gets a boost after announcing its joint...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.5%) and Ericsson (ERIC +6.4%) gets a boost after announcing its joint venture, ST-Ericsson, has appointed Didier Lamouche as president and chief executive officer. Mr. Lamouche will assume the post beginning December 1st.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • YNDX

    Russian search engine Yandex (YNDX +5.9%) increases its mobile offerings by acquiring privately...

    Russian search engine Yandex (YNDX +5.9%) increases its mobile offerings by acquiring privately held SPB Software, a software developer for smartphones and tablets with offices in Russia, Taiwan and Thailand. Financial details on the deal were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +10.5%) skies on the announcement of a joint venture with Daido Steel and...

    Molycorp (MCP +10.5%) skies on the announcement of a joint venture with Daido Steel and Mitsubishi to produce and sell "next-generation neodymium-iron-boron permanent rare earth magnets." The production will make use of a new technology allowing greater magnet performance with less reliance on the scarce rare earth dysprosium. End users will be the automotive and home appliance industries. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW +13.9%) is the hottest stock on the S&P 500, as Citigroup upgrades the...

    Genworth (GNW +13.9%) is the hottest stock on the S&P 500, as Citigroup upgrades the mortgage insurer to Buy because of an "attractive relative valuation that... substantially overdiscounts the challenges the company faces.” Concerns about a possible bankruptcy have swirled as rival PMI Group struggled, but Citi says bankruptcy is “not a realistic threat" to GNW.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FLR

    Fluor (FLR +7%) jumps on a Baird upgrade to Outperform on valuation, as its current price...

    Fluor (FLR +7%) jumps on a Baird upgrade to Outperform on valuation, as its current price doesn't accurately reflect the company's strength. It dominates its sector, and performance will continue to benefit from a solid pipeline and strength in its international resource-driven markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -0.3%) is underperforming today in spite of a bullish note from Canaccord's...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -0.3%) is underperforming today in spite of a bullish note from Canaccord's Mike Walkley, following meetings with the wireless chipmaker's strategy VP. Walkley sees Spreadtrum delivering a strong 2012, thanks in part to growing shipments of 3G TD-SCDMA chips in its core Chinese market, and increasing sales of 2G GSM chips in other markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (FOSL +6.9%) gets a boost from a Benchmark upgrade to Buy on valuation, citing the...

    Fossil (FOSL +6.9%) gets a boost from a Benchmark upgrade to Buy on valuation, citing the company's strong start to the holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • SINA

    SINA shares bounce back from a decline of more than 10% as Muddy Waters tweets, "There is NO...

    SINA shares bounce back from a decline of more than 10% as Muddy Waters tweets, "There is NO report forthcoming. MW has done zero work on SINA." The outfit is responding to a WSJ report that the Chinese online concern was to be MW's next target. Shares -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Bucking the Street’s dim view of Research In Motion (RIMM +1.7%), Scotia Capital's Gus...

    Bucking the Street’s dim view of Research In Motion (RIMM +1.7%), Scotia Capital's Gus Papageorgiou calls the stock "absurdly oversold," as its $1B-plus in quarterly service fee revenue ensures continued high profitability. But Sterne Agee's Shaw Wu cuts shares to Neutral and trims 2012 and 2013 estimates; there's still some value as a takeover target, the only reason it isn’t yet an outright Sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • YOKU

    Goldman and Mirae Asset think a Chinese government plan to eliminate advertising during the...

    Goldman and Mirae Asset think a Chinese government plan to eliminate advertising during the airing of TV dramas is a positive for online video providers such as Youku.com (YOKU +6.9%) and Tudou (TUDO +2.7%). Mirae believes at least 15%-20% of the RMB 20B in ad revenue that will be lost due to this mandate will flow to online video providers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • XPER

    Tessera (TSRA +4.2%) trades higher after the U.S. Supreme Court rejects requests to review an...

    Tessera (TSRA +4.2%) trades higher after the U.S. Supreme Court rejects requests to review an earlier ITC ruling that found its patents were valid, and several competing firms had infringed upon them. The U.S. Court of Appeals had affirmed the ITC's decision last December, and the defendant companies asked the Supreme Court to review the case. The court rejected their appeals without comment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR +5.8%) shares are "attractively valued for a year-end long trade," JPMorgan says,...

    Coinstar (CSTR +5.8%) shares are "attractively valued for a year-end long trade," JPMorgan says, raising its outlook based on conservative near-term guidance heading into a strong Q4. But CSTR is no buy-and-hold candidate: “We believe the DVD kiosk rental opportunity will be saturated by late 2012... 68% of households are already within five-minute drive-time of a Redbox kiosk."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • ARTC

    ArthroCare (NASDAQ:ARTC) tacks on a 9.4% gain after announcing a $74M agreement to settle a...

    ArthroCare (NASDAQ:ARTC) tacks on a 9.4% gain after announcing a $74M agreement to settle a class action lawsuit pending against the medical devices firm in relation to securities transactions between Dec. 11, 2007 and Feb. 18, 2009.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • CVLT

    CommVault (CVLT +7.9%) joins Quantum (QTM-OLD +7.1%) in taking off on speculation NetApp (NTAP...

    CommVault (CVLT +7.9%) joins Quantum (QTM-OLD +7.1%) in taking off on speculation NetApp (NTAP +3.5%) might bid for the company. Though unlike Quantum, which sports a price/sales ratio of just 0.8, CommVault wouldn't come cheap: the storage software vendor, which has been taking share from Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) in major enterprise accounts, has a trailing P/E of 51.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +10.5%) trade higher after the NBA announces a labor deal...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +10.5%) trade higher after the NBA announces a labor deal which if passed by owners and players will preserve a 66-game season after the prospect for a washout of the entire season loomed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON +3.8%) shares move higher after Reuters reports that France's highest court...

    Monsanto (MON +3.8%) shares move higher after Reuters reports that France's highest court cancels all decisions banning the use of the company's genetically modified maize cultivation in France.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +9.4%) pops after Piper Jaffray upgrades it to Neutral ahead of its...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +9.4%) pops after Piper Jaffray upgrades it to Neutral ahead of its lorcaserin New Drug Application re-submission at year-end. Piper says the company has made substantial progress addressing the FDA's requests in its recent Complete Response Letter, and rectified all the necessary issues to meet the final requirements.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN +4.6%) outperforms many of its large-cap chip peers after ThinkEquity's...

    Texas Instruments (TXN +4.6%) outperforms many of its large-cap chip peers after ThinkEquity's Krishna Shankar upgrades shares to Buy, and lifts his his EPS estimates. Though expecting TI's mid-quarter update next week to be "muted," Shankar considers near-term weakness priced in, and expects TI to gain share in its core analog, mixed-signal, and embedded processing chip markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • FL

    Foot Locker (FL +8.8%) takes off after UBS upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral and on the...

    Foot Locker (FL +8.8%) takes off after UBS upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral and on the strength of strong traffic at malls on Black Friday. ShopperTrak calculates retail foot traffic jumped 5.1% Y/Y for the annual shop-a-thon. A tentative deal to end the NBAlockout may also be contributing to the rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • EA

    With Electronic Arts' (ERTS +6.9%) shares off 17% from recent highs, Citigroup's Neil Doshi sees...

    With Electronic Arts' (ERTS +6.9%) shares off 17% from recent highs, Citigroup's Neil Doshi sees an attractive entry point, expecting a favorable reaction to a strong Black Friday, increased traction on its social/mobile platforms, and the upcoming Star Wars game. Channel checks at NYC-area Best Buy stores find that "some of the more popular items were video games."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • SINA

    Bucking today's meltup is Chinese online media company SINA, off 3.5% on a WSJ-China report the...

    Bucking today's meltup is Chinese online media company SINA, off 3.5% on a WSJ-China report the firm could be the next target of Muddy Waters research. SINA CEO Charles Chao has served on the board of Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) - Muddy Waters' most recent victim - since 2005.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • QSR

    Shares of AFC Enterprises (AFCE +12.5%) gain on heavy volume after the franchise restaurant...

    Shares of AFC Enterprises (AFCE +12.5%) gain on heavy volume after the franchise restaurant operator reports interest in franchising is starting to take off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • AEO

    Investors in retailers choose to accentuate the positive and eliminate any potential negative,...

    Investors in retailers choose to accentuate the positive and eliminate any potential negative, as retail stocks (XRT +3.9%) post major moves in the early going. Among the notable gainers: AEO +5.2%, ANF +4.6%, BBY +4.2%, TIF +5.6%, AMZN +5.3%, JCP +3.5%, KSS +2.4%, TGT +2.3%, WMT +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM

  • European shares leg up to new highs on the day, the broad Stoxx 50 +5%. The best performing...

    European shares leg up to new highs on the day, the broad Stoxx 50 +5%. The best performing market is France, +5.1%. The laggard is the U.K., +2.9%. The last rally of this sort was Oct. 27, before that, July 21 - both world-class selling opportunities. Will today be different?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) come out of the gate roaring, up 9.5%, as reports of...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) come out of the gate roaring, up 9.5%, as reports of strong Black Friday sales both online and in stores (I, II, III) pile up. Though the company announced a wide variety of Cyber Monday deals, it appears to be holding the line on the price of its flagship Nook devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +5.3%) is reportedly in talks to buy rival content delivery network Cotendo, which...

    Akamai (AKAM +5.3%) is reportedly in talks to buy rival content delivery network Cotendo, which it's currently suing, for more than $300M. Dan Rayburn views Cotendo as a growing threat to Akamai, with customers claiming the Israeli startup's network is both faster and cheaper for certain high-margin applications. Publicly-traded rival Limelight (LLNW +6.6%) is also surging.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • GD

    Like Netflix, General Dynamics (GD +3.7%) received a positive mention in Barron's over the...

    Like Netflix, General Dynamics (GD +3.7%) received a positive mention in Barron's over the weekend, with the paper arguing the strength of its Gulfstream jet division can offset an expected decline in defense contracts. It's noted that Morgan Stanley's Heidi Wood believes the Gulfstream division could account for 50% of General Dynamics' profits in the next 5 years, up from 20% today.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) gain 4.7% premarket after nabbing an upgrade from Keybanc...

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) gain 4.7% premarket after nabbing an upgrade from Keybanc to Buy from Hold along with a $145 price target. Analysts with the firm point to a "robust" Macau gaming market as buoying the gaming company's prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) gains 6% premarket after the firm announces that it secured a...

    Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) gains 6% premarket after the firm announces that it secured a key patent for its Parkinson's disease treatment from the USPTO. CEO Geoffrey Kempler says the granted rights will further boost Prana's commercialization plans after a grant from the Michael J. Fox Foundation helped allow the firm to undertake development studies.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: Thanksgiving weekend sales appear to have been strong but may not have been,...

    Market preview: Thanksgiving weekend sales appear to have been strong but may not have been, another plan to save the eurozone is in the works but may again amount to nothing, and a report says the IMF may lend to Italy but it won't. Not to worry, it's the thought that counts, and shares surge in the EU and U.S., with S&P futures +2.9%. Later: new home sales, Dallas Fed.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • IRE

    Bank Of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) shares jump after announcing strong progress toward meeting its...

    Bank Of Ireland (NYSE:IRE) shares jump after announcing strong progress toward meeting its commitments to deleverage its huge balance sheet by selling a nominal €590M worth of North American and European loans to Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. IRE +14.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • CMC

    Bloomberg reports Carl Icahn has offered to buy Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC) for $15/share. Last...

    Bloomberg reports Carl Icahn has offered to buy Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC) for $15/share. Last trade on Friday: $11.45. Shares +25.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW) says it has officially formed its joint venture, Sadara Chemical Co., with...

    Dow Chemical (DOW) says it has officially formed its joint venture, Sadara Chemical Co., with state-owned Saudi Aramco to build one of the world’s largest chemical plants in Saudi Arabia’s Eastern Province on the Persian Gulf coast. DOW +3.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • IRE
